newsitem.title: USA: Boeing moving closer to super jumbo launch.
newsitem.headline: Boeing moving closer to super jumbo launch.

text.p: Boeing Co on Thursday gave the clearest indication yet that its plans for two "stretch" versions of the 747 jumbo jet will be given formal approval for production soon.

Boeing had been expected to announce the launch of the 747-500X and 747-600x at the Farnborough Air Show in England last month but instead merely unveiled details of the planned jets, saying it did not yet have sufficient orders.

But Malaysian Airlines officials were quoted by the National Bernama news agency Thursday as saying the company's board of directors had agreed to purchase six of the aircraft in order to be the launch customer.
Boeing spokesman Chris Villiers confirmed the Asian carrier was likely to be among the launch customers for the new jet.
"Boeing is offering the 747-600X and 747-500x to a number of the world's airlines," he said. "We anticipate that Malaysian Airline System will be one of the launch customers for the new 747 family."
British Airways Plc and Singapore Airlines Ltd. are among the carriers that have expressed strong interest in a jet bigger than the current 747 for heavily travelled international routes.
Analysts have said they expect Boeing to launch the derivative model, probably early next year, with orders from six or more airlines that coule be worth $10 billion or more.
